turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Gummy and two cops...

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Cool your tool, Frank, I need a little more time. I think I'm really on to something here.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: You're onto something. That's good. What?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I really don't want to spoil your surprise, Frank. Why don't you read it tomorrow?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Just give me a hint, all right?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: All right. Maybe there are some crooked cops involved in all this.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: More cops.  I think I gotta go to Utah, Frank.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Utah?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Yeah. It's wedged in between Wyoming and Nevada. I'm sure you've seen pictures.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: What about finding the source?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I have some ideas.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Who? Donnie and Marie?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Very possibly. Come on, say yes. I'll buy you a shirt.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Go to transportation, get a ticket.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: How could you call him?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: It's called journalism, Fletch. It's called getting both sides of the story. Something you apparently don't know anything about.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: It's also called getting me this close to being murdered.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Get out of here.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He threw me in a cell, took a gun and a knife and threatened to kill me right there if I didn't promise to give up the story.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: You know, I've had it up to here with your bullshit. I need a story from you by tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You'll have it.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: But not unsubstantiated charges about dope-dealing cops, and not horse shit paranoid fantasies about homicidal police chiefs.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Thanks for the vote of confidence, Frank.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: I want something I can print!

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Print this Frank.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm quitting, Frank. As of midnight tonight.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: What?  Who the hell are they?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: This is Fat Sam, and this is Gummy.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: What...

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Their statements, naming Chief Cummings as the numero uno drug pusher from here to Oxnard. I want them to have federal protection under the paper's sponsorship.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm out, Frank. You lost faith in me.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Fletch, I got nervous. Please....

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Fletch, you want an apology?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You were going to can me, right?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Not really?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: I was upset.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm sick of this place. I'm going to try out for the Lakers. They need a power forward.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Fletch.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Oh, Margie, sorry, Frieda lost the number of Alan's realtor in Provo. Can you give it to me real quick?

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Jim Swarthout?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: And, I'm sorry, who are you again?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Frieda's boss.

turns.speaker: MARGIE
turns.text: Who's Frieda?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: My secretary.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: MR. UNDERHILL
turns.text: Mrs. Stanwyk, I hate to disturb you. Tom Underhill here... I'm a new member.

turns.speaker: MR. UNDERHILL
turns.text: Apparently, someone of your acquaintance has charged the most extraordinary lunch to my bill.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: John!

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: You don't know the Underhills?

turns.speaker: MR. UNDERHILL
turns.text: I'd appreciate an opportunity to discuss this with you.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I just stepped out of the shower! Can you give me a minute?

turns.speaker: MR. UNDERHILL
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: MR. UNDERHILL
turns.text: Mrs. Stanwyk!

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: In a minute!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: But I ain't got you...

turns.speaker: BAND
turns.text: But I ain't got you...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: No, I ain't got you...

turns.speaker: BAND
turns.text: No, I ain't got you...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I said, I ain't got you...

turns.speaker: BAND
turns.text: I said, I ain't got you...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I ain't -- got -- you.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Ford Fairlane, I'm Colleen Sutton and I need your help.  I have a problem and it pertains to the music industry.  What is it they call you?  Mr. Rock and...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Don't say it.  Orange juice?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Sorry about the glass.  And the house.  And the breath.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Mr. Fairlane, I'm very rich.  The kind of rich that warps minds. Nothing offends me.  When I was eleven, I walked in on my father and the Shetland pony he had given me for my tenth birthday. Does that excite you?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I don't know, I never met your father.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Oh, that!  Don't take it personally. He always wakes up before I do. Down boy!  Roseanne Barr naked!

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Who's your decorator?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Some fag.  Charged me up the ass.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Fag?  Ass?  I'm sorry, is that a joke?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Poor taste.  I know.  Listen, I respect homosexuals.  When I was young, my maid was a homosexual.  My maid was a homosexual.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I don't have a sense of humor, either.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Now that we've broken the ice...

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I need you to find my little sister. She goes by the name Zuzu...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Zuzu Petals.  You want me to rescue her from the gorgeous hell that is L.A.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: But how did you know?  Here, take this picture...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: No thanks.  I carry my own.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Let's see, you're her worried sister.  Yesterday I met her worried father who incidentally was about five years younger than you. In fact, I capped off the evening by watching him get electrocuted. They talk about cases like this in the private eye handbook... something about a ten-foot pole.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Five thousand should be enough to assuage any qualms you have about my family tree.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, but of course for now, I only get a twenty.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Actually, you may take it all now.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Oh... I have some questions.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I have no answers.  Thanks for the stain.  Find the girl.  In the envelope are tickets to the Dorothy Chandler.  We'll chat again, then.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Ah, the Dorothy Chandler.  I was just there with my good friend Art Mooney the other night...

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Nuthin'.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: My God, Mr. Fairlane, you look like the Fall of Saigon.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Colleen and Johnny, sitting in a tree, k-i-s-s-i-n-g...

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Uh, let's go sit down.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: So you know about Johnny Crunch and myself.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'm sorry, that's gotta be a pair of tube socks he has down there.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Ouch... Of course I want off the case.  Some monster from Woodstock tried and succeeded in killing me tonight.  The fact I'm alive's a technicality.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: So you...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Listen, Queen Collie, I have a code. I never, ever, drop a case.  Besides, I, uh, used all your money to pay my bills, so I kinda owe you.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Nonsense.  After what you've been through, it sounds like I owe you.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: They did one of these about my ex- wife.  It's called 'The Nutcracker.'  'The Nut-crack-er'... I don't need money.  I need some questions answered.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I'll do my best.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Question one:  Can I have some money?  Kidding.  Why didn't you tell me about you and Johnny?  You two were into something even more dangerous than sex, weren't you? Who?  What?  Where?  How?  Now.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Jonathan was such a beautiful man. No one knew him like I did... Excuse me.  I can't do this now. I'll call you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Thanks for the information. Appreciate it.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I ask you to find a girl and instead you steal a C.D. from me. Ford.  You suck.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'll buy you a new one.  I found her.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Zuzu Petals!  Did she have it?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Have what?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Did she tell you anything?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Lots of things.  Her favorite yogurt.  The ten drummers she would take to a desert island...

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Drink your cappucino, you're giving me a headache...

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Damnit... you were right last night. Jonathan and I were into more than sex.  Along with Bobby Vomit, right after old Jack Grendel died, we took part in a scheme to rip off Grendel records... I didn't want you involved...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: But I am...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What cheap shit... hey, waiter!

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: We invested in these factories. In Vancouver.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Hold that thought.  Are we being shot at?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: That was close...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What did these Vancouver factories do?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Art Mo-o-o-ney!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Thanks, I needed that.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: So many assholes, so few bullets.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Damn, Ford, you're the most cynical man in the industry and that's not easy.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'm not cynical.  Can I help it that life is a disease and everyone's a victim. So you're producing exclusively for Grendel Records now.  Hope you're taking Julian for a bundle.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Man, ever since old Jack Grendel died, Julian has got me into one yummy gig after the other.  Not only am I producing, he's got me in some lovely-bullshit-money-money executive position.  What are you looking at...

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: You gotta shave before you leave the house in a dress like that and I don't mean your legs.  Why didn't you jump on her?  What's happening to you?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I guess I'm not interested in any club who'll have my member as a member.  Later, Don...

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: I haven't seen her around, and as for who would want to kill Johnny Crunch, line forms to the left. You'd find less people on our planet who wanted him alive.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Great pipes.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I've heard cars fuck with more harmony.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Tell me about it. Name's Kyle Troy.  Can't we bring up the bass.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Julian's happy as long as he doesn't see glass shatter.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I never thought I'd be jealous of your handicap... Sorry to hear about Bobby Vomit.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Have a copy of that sent to me, will ya?

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Right away!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Hey, Don, how's the high blood pressure.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Could somebody tell me what's going on?  <u>Like slo-owly</u>...

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Thanks for the promotion, man.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: No prob...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Your tip paid off.  Jazz, this is Sam the Sleazebag.  Sam the Sleazebag, this is Jazz, my secretary.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Assistant.  And don't call me Jazz.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: All your friends call you Jazz.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: You wish.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Cash or check, Jazz?  Don't do this to me.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I do it for love.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: 'Bye Ford...'  Hey, let me cheer you up.  I found the IN X S payment.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: G'day, they say it's worth three grand...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Fucking Australians!  I hate that country, continent, what is it? Don't we do nuclear testing there?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Let's just declare war on the hellhole.  Before they make <u>Crocodile Dundee</u> three.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Rock stars!  I'm going out of my mind.  All I get are perks.  I don't make money, I make gifts. How am I supposed to pay taxes with bathtub compact disc players and autographed drumsticks.  I want cash.  Moulah.  Wampum.  Dead Presidents.  Andrew Jackson. Gerald Ford.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: You're saying you need money.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Car insurance costs money. Cavities cost money.  Doritos cost money.  I'm gonna eat that damn bear... come here!

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Quit crying.  I think we've got a case if we can make it through the cavalcade of bimbos, here...

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: You're friends with the most obnoxious asshole on the airwaves. The King of the Shock Jocks.  I'm, I'm shocked.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I love you, too, baby.  He wants to meet at six.  What time is it now?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: That's for me... Radio contests, really Ford, how tacky...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Ah -- ha... You know, you should think about dating Earthmen again.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: So what about this watch?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Keep it.  It's your paycheck this month.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Quiet.  Tell me you tapped in the police computer and found out lots of good stuff about Art Mooney...

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: I found a lot of Art Mooneys. None with a police record, though. Not even Synchronicity.  Have you checked out Johnny Pinzolo/Crunch's houseboat yet?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Tonight after I see Don. Some Beverly Hillbilly just hired me to find you-know-fucking-who. Name's Colleen Sutton.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Spooky.  I'll process her.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Cool.  Jazz, meet me at the Dorothy Chandler Pavilion tonight. I'll have a ticket for you at the door.  Some concert.  Could be interesting.  Dress nice.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Sorry, Jazz.  After this, I'll throw a burger down your throat, okay?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: You're a fucking gentleman.  What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: This Colleen Sutton woman I'm with. If she flees me to go powder her whatever, I need you to keep tabs...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You going to be okay?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Go on, 'they're stahting.'

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: And it's good to see you, Julian. This is my assistant, Jazz.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Mmmmmmm.  Mmmm, mmm.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Why did you interrupt?  Maxwell seemed like he wanted to hire me.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Shut up, goodies from the ice queen.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: How'd you get this from her?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: You don't want to know, believe me. But don't worry, I washed my hands...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: A fucking C.D.  Wow, this case is closed.  So, she's got bad taste in music and in men... Did I tell you she and Johnny were lovers and that they were into something and he got killed for it?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: No, as a matter of fact you didn't. What about the girl, Zuzu Petals, how does she fit in?  I mean, she is what this case is about.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I wish I knew.  You did good work...

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Make eye contact when you say that.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'm sorry, that dress.  What do you say we...

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Celebrate?  Like we celebrated after solving the White Bluesman murders?  Forget it, man.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What did you... Hey, where's your spex?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Contacts.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I like.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I don't know, what was the case?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Ms. Sutton hired you to find the girl.  Period.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Then I guess her case is closed. Mine isn't.  I want to know why everybody wants Zuzu.  Why people are killing and dying for her.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: She's just a bundle of energy, a real treasure...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, let's bury her.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Hello...  It's Colleen.  With answers.  She wants to meet.  Down.  Way down-town.  Late.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Lieutenant Anus has discovered the cold-blooded killer behind everything.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Ah, an obvious choice.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Let's get her out of here, before she starts a shoot-out.  Drop us at my place.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Hello, Ford...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What are you doing at the office? You wouldn't believe what I've gone through tonight... I'm calling from the Mega Beta Pogo Sorority.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: I came to warn you...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Oh, Jazz, those bastards... call an ambulance!  Get that music off!

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: I believe the last time we came across one of these, was at the ballet.  What were your words...  'A fucking C.D.  This case is closed.'

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I've always said the one reason I'm the best detective in the industry is that I'm the only one... but hey, I never throw away a clue...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Aha, just what I suspected!

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: You're not funny.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Hmmm, the first disc was putting out an incomprehensible stream of high bits.  This one is putting out low bits.  The data is in some fucked binary system.  The two discs need to interface simultaneously with a third decryptor disc.  Comprendo?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Su-ure.  Two people hired me to find Zuzu in order to get hold of one of those discs and Colleen threw a tizz when we took hers.  Obviously, all this binary disc shit is pretty mighty.  But it's not necessary.  People are dead.  One was a friend.  The same people were involved in a scam to rip off Grendel Records. Bottom line's Julian Grendel is doing a little revenge number...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Your timing swallows the massive one. Grendel just tried to kill us, he's about to frame and kiss Don, and we can't do shit.  Don't even ask about those discs. Goddamn that Art Mooney with a star by his name!  It's tied to Johnny's C.D., I know.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Johnny's C.D.?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What an interface!

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Seems to be information about a factory in Vancouver.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, Colleen mentioned it.  What do they make?

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: C.D.s.  The music kind.  From the Grendel label.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Without Grendel knowing about it. B-I-N-G-O and Bingo was his name-O. Counterfeit C.D.s.  Tape piracy has graduated to disc piracy, the sound quality's better, and so's the money.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: But the funny thing is, take a look at these Swiss bank account numbers. We got Bobby, Johnny, Colleen... and Julian Grendel.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: After their initial investment in the factory, Grendel didn't need them.  Told them to fuck off. They tried to get these C.D.s together in order to have proof of Grendel's involvement, so they could keep him in line.  Now's the fun part...

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: I can't believe I lost an eye for a bunch of phony C.D.s

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: I just can't deal with all this crap between us, I'm sorry.  I'm quitting.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Let's get hitched.  I guess I, you know, love you.  It's a beautiful thing.

turns.speaker: JAZZ
turns.text: Wha --

turns.speaker: SLEAZY GUY
turns.text: Got those Vomit invites here...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Scalping to a funeral, you're a pretty sleazy guy.

turns.speaker: SLEAZY GUY
turns.text: Thanks.  You interested.  It's festival seating, so...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: SLEAZY GUY
turns.text: Three hundred.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You gave it to the girls for one.

turns.speaker: SLEAZY GUY
turns.text: Hey, they blew me.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Oh.  Three hundred coming right up.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Zuzu Petals!  Zuzu Petals!  Yes! Who killed Bobby Vomit?  Who killed Johnny Crunch?  Why do people want you so goddamn bad?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: I don't know.  I'm so scared. Help me.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: A simple 'please' would suffice...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Fluck you!

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: It's red, Ford.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Give me your gum and grab the wheel.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Peachy.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Let's get serious...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Why are all these people after me?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Uh... wha?  You're supposed to answer those questions, not ask 'em.  I take it a woman named Colleen Sutton is not your big sister and that the late D.J. Johnny Crunch ain't your daddy?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: I'm so sure!  I'm an only child and my parents are Bill and Shirley Petals of South Bend, Indiana. They run a hardware store and...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You hung out with Bobby Vomit. Who would want him dead?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: I dunno.  He was to sound what Cezanne was to image or at least I thought so.  Ever since he died, I've been chased... <u>Omigod</u>!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What?  Jesus, tell me!

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: It's Spunk Lewis, the lead singer for Dead Ribbit!  Mr. Bus Driver, stop!

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Spunk, come back...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: How is it you can look at that HairHead and see God, when all I see is a lucky asshole from Reseda.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Because I know rock-n-roll.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You know rock-n-roll?  Darlin', I've been in the music industry for as long as you've lived.  I've seen things you can't even have nightmares about... but then I guess I'm just not equipped to know the industry the way you do...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Come again?  B.FL.D., I have sex with rock stars; it's not like I'm doing something that I don't enjoy with them, like shuffleboard. Don't worry about me, I practice safe sex and next summer, I'm going to U.C.L.A.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Zuzu Petals, you're not bad.  In fact, I was discussing this whole rock-n-roll thing with my pal Art Mooney the other day.  You know him?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: No.  Who's Art Mooney?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: He's the lamest clue I've ever had in my life.  Here's our stop...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Yeah, it's weird.  Bobby and Johnny were such good friends...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Friends?  You didn't tell me that.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: You didn't ask.  Have you ever thought about mousse?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Why are you depressed?  You get in all the clubs, you never pay cover...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Stop.  We still got serious detective stuff to do, but we've been up all night so we should hit the sack for...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: What a perv...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Let's watch some 'M.T.V.'

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: People still watch that?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Who cares about people?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Zuzu, wake up...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Hah fluck, great video, huh?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Okay?  I just blew up.  I feel orgasmic.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: My axe!

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Ford, do you got something cooking in the microwave?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: I know the feeling.  This must be hell.  Can you believe, a flucking sorority... I'm gonna vomit Day-Glo.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Ye-ah.  Sure.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: This is boring, guys.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Zuzu, be quiet.  Put in Colleen's disc.  Number two.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Ford, you were right!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Ye-ah.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'm afraid so, you want her?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: But you know, that was just a dream.  Doesn't really count.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Nice left you got there, jerk.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Sorry, it was dark, now come on.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: This way...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: No, wait...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Suck a dick, I left my purse...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: As Clark Gable said to Ava Gardner in Mogambo:  'Fuck the purse, we're gonna die-e-e.'

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Reality-reality-reality -- Outrageous building, huh?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Ye-ah.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Pretty smooth, huh?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Smooth.  I know this is dangerous and everything but it's kind of fun. Ever see "Batman," you know when Batman and Robin are climbing up the side of the building and somebody sticks their head outside the window and says... I forget what they said but it's pretty funny.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Why have you come to my planet?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Ick.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I won't ask why you would want to help someone trying to kill you, but hey, good job.  Shall we?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Hey.  God.  You're an asshole.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Let go of the belt!  What are you doing?  You got mad at me for trying to save the other guy.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I can't kill this kid's father...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Who do you think you are, Ford? The tooth fairy.  Kill!  Kill!  Kill!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: This is fucking unbelievable.  Zuzu, it's a long story, you see...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Hello, Mr. Tongue!  What a perv.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You wish.  Come on, let's get outta here.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: There's that question...

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Oh how sweet, your friend's got his own star.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: ArtArtArtArtMooneyMooneyMooney Mooney.

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: You-see-it-all-starts-with-this- factory-in-Vancouver-and there's these-C.D.s...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'll mail you a letter, come on!

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Hoh graphic!  I'm going to dream of ears for a year!  Ugh!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Just be thankful he wasn't dissatisfied with his sex life.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: So, Zuzu.  Are you okay?

turns.speaker: ZUZU
turns.text: Yeah, Ford.  I'm okay.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Fairlane, you gonna find out who killed the lead singer of Black Vomit?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Tell me, Dr. Watson, what makes you think he's not just another piece of shit overdose.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Gut feeling.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'll give you a gut feeling, you little... Hey... <u>hey</u>!  Get that stick out of your mouth.  These things are killers, man.  Don't you go to school, listen to Smokey the Bear and all that...
